title: Microsoft Bows to Pressure to Free Up Cloud Security Logs
description:
Facing intense pressure after Chinese APT hack, Microsoft plans to expand logging defaults for lower-tier M365 customers.

The post Microsoft Bows to Pressure to Free Up Cloud Security Logs appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Recycling Giant Tomra Takes Systems Offline Following Cyberattack
description:
Norwegian recycling giant Tomra says internal systems have been taken offline to contain an extensive cyberattack.

The post Recycling Giant Tomra Takes Systems Offline Following Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Two Jira Plugin Vulnerabilities in Attacker Crosshairs
description:
Attackers are exploiting two path traversal vulnerabilities in the Stagil navigation for Jira – Menus & Themes plugin.

The post Two Jira Plugin Vulnerabilities in Attacker Crosshairs appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Virtual Event Today: 2023 Cloud & Data Security Summit
description:
Register for the Cloud & Data Security Summit to learn how to utilize tools, controls, and design models needed to properly secure cloud environments.

The post Virtual Event Today: 2023 Cloud & Data Security Summit appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Recently Patched GE Cimplicity Vulnerabilities Reminiscent of Russian ICS Attacks
description:
Over a dozen vulnerabilities patched by GE in its Cimplicity HMI/SCADA product are reminiscent of ICS attacks conducted by the Russian Sandworm group.

The post Recently Patched GE Cimplicity Vulnerabilities Reminiscent of Russian ICS Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Security Awareness Training Isn’t Working – How Can We Improve It?
description:
Security awareness training isn’t working to the level it needs to. Social engineering, however, is getting better. Why doesn’t awareness training work, and how can we improve it?

The post Security Awareness Training Isn’t Working – How Can We Improve It? appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Oracle Releases 508 New Security Patches With July 2023 CPU
description:
Oracle has released 508 new security patches as part of the July 2023 CPU, including more than 70 that address critical vulnerabilities

The post Oracle Releases 508 New Security Patches With July 2023 CPU appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Exploitation of New Citrix Zero-Day Likely to Increase, Organizations Warned
description:
Citrix has patched several vulnerabilities, including CVE-2023-3519, a critical remote code execution zero-day that has been exploited in attacks.

The post Exploitation of New Citrix Zero-Day Likely to Increase, Organizations Warned appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Chrome 115 Patches 20 Vulnerabilities
description:
Chrome 115 released with patches for 20 vulnerabilities, including 11 reported by external researchers, who earned thousands of dollars in bug bounties.

The post Chrome 115 Patches 20 Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.
